title: What We Do in the Shadows
subheading: A rich look at the lives of 4 vampires and one plucky familiar living on Staten Island
review:
Even if you’re already a fan of vampires, this mockumentary will deepen your understanding of vampiric culture and give you a greater appreciation for their nightly struggles. Nandor the Relentless, Nadja, and Laszlo (Vampire tricked in Steam Room) star as roommates along with the ‘energy vampire’ Colin Robinson and their oft mistreated human servant Guillermo.

From the brilliant comic mind of Jemaine Clement (Flight of the Conchords), this superb owl of writing and acting is sure to hypnotize. Submit to its dark power and have some laughs.

title: The Politician
starring: Ben Platt, Gwyneth Paltrow, Jessica Lange
subheading: When Payton Hobart commits his whole life to becoming President, any mistake in his high school election could cost him his chances - and he’ll do anything to win
review: While you would expect a show about student politics to be fairly dry and predictable, The Politician is a whirlwind of rising stakes and twists that will keep you guessing till the very end. The excellent cast delivers multidimensional characters that are as flawed as they are darkly humorous, and the storytelling is fast, offbeat, and fresh. From the creators of Glee (Ian Brennan, Brad Falchuk, and Ryan Murphy), this high school drama is definitely worth casting your vote for.

title: Letterkenny
subheading: A hilarious, distinctly Canadian, show about the toughest folks in the rural town of Letterkenny
review:
You can’t make a comedy without craking an ag, and Letterkenny is the perfect omelette of quick wit and down home goodness. From furious hockey coaches, to the skids, to the degens from upcountry, Wayne, Katy, Squirrelly Dan, and Daryl (the hicks) have their hands full keeping the problems in Letterkenny at bay the old fashioned way. Yous gots to watch it.

The jokes fly as fast as the fists in Letterkenny so it’s best to keep the subtitles on so you can “figure it out”. Pitter Patter!

title: The Get Down
description: In 1977 New York City, the talented and soulful youth of the South Bronx chase dreams and breakneck beats to transform music history.
starring: Justice Smith, Shameik Moore, Herizen Guardiola
subheading: A stunning musical drama about the origins of hip hop in the 1970s told through the eyes of a group of kids in the Bronx
review: Well researched and meticulously produced, The Get Down is a vivid kaleidoscope into the colorful crucible of graffiti, disco, poetry, and political upheaval that birthed one of the most influential musical genres of our time. Baz Luhrmann intentionally involved key members of the hip hop world in the show’s production and vision (including Nasir Jones and Grandmaster Flash) to create one of the best and most authentic musical dramas ever made.

title: Party Down
description: While chasing dreams of stardom, six Hollywood wannabe actors and writers make ends meet by working for a posh Los Angeles catering company, which tackles a different event -- senior singles mixer, porn awards after party, a Super Sweet 16 bash -- in each episode.
subheading: A group of failed Hollywood hopefuls are forced to work together at the Party Down catering company as they wait to make it big
review: If you’ve ever worked in the service industry, you’ll find this show as cathartic as it is entertaining. Hijinxs and relatable banter ensue as the characters are pressed up against the glass of success at the affluent parties where they hold trays and serve drinks in desperation. Party Down is a gem of comedy that begs the question everyone wants to hear: “Are we having fun yet?”.

title: The OA
description: Seven years after vanishing from her home, a young woman returns with mysterious new abilities and recruits five strangers for a secret mission.
starring: Brit Marling, Jason Isaacs, Emory Cohen
subheading: A missing girl reappears in her hometown under circumstances so mysterious that a small group of people she befriends begin questioning the nature of their reality
review: A uniquely creative and haunting show that rewards the viewer’s careful attention with a complex story arc spanning 2 seasons. A beautiful mixture of magical realism, science fiction, and drama, this show will tug you by the heartstrings into an ocean of chilling questions that will keep you awake at night.
